info.description:
API for writing Dataset Definitions and Entities.

_CIDS does not transform the input data in any kind. The writer of the data owns it and is responsible for this data. CIDS provides a way to ingest the custom investment data into Aladdin for usage across Portfolio Management tools._
info.title: Custom Investment Dataset Writer

post.description: Create new Dataset Definition. A Dataset can be Category, Class, Group or Leaf Level Dataset.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description: Dataset Definition to be created.
parameters.name: body

post.description:
Activate Dataset Definition in a DRAFT state. 
Dataset Definition will be activatetd and moved to APPROVED state so that entities can be added to this Dataset or to its child level Datasets. 
Any level of Dataset can be activated if its parent is in APPROVED state.

post.description:
Expire APPROVED Dataset Definition. 
Dataset Definition will be expired and moved to RETIRED state so that Entities cannot be added to this Dataset or to its child level Datasets. 
Any level of Dataset can be expired if its child level Dataset is in RETIRED state.

post.description:
Create Entities in an approved Dataset. 
Entities can only be created under leaf level approved Dataset and can not be created under Category, Class or Group Level Dataset.
max number of entities is specified in CIDS_CONFIG decode with MAX_ENTITIES decde
For schematized dataset, 10MM is the max count allowed for Row X Column cartesian product, example: if you have 100 attributes per entity, then you can have maximum 100k entities for that dataset

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description: Name of the Dataset in which entities to be created. This must match with the Dataset Name on each input Entity.
parameters.name: parent

post.description: For CIDS UI to server usage only. This endpoints accepts an uploaded file from the CID Manager UI for loading entities on a dataset. This endpoint is not meant for direct usage by other apps and instead please use the create entities dedicated endpoint for uploading entities on a dataset.

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

revisionId.description: Version of the DRAFT Dataset to be activated. User can fetch Version of DRAFT Datset using 'Retrieve all Dataset Definitions' API.

v1AttributeAgg.description:
- ATTRIBUTE_AGG_UNSPECIFIED: Aggregate function unspecified. This is an error scenario
 - ATTRIBUTE_AGG_SUM: Aggregate sum function
 - ATTRIBUTE_AGG_ABS_SUM: Aggregate absolute sum function
 - ATTRIBUTE_AGG_WT_AVG: Aggregate weighted average function
 - ATTRIBUTE_AGG_MEDIAN: Aggregate median function
v1AttributeAgg.title: Describes attribute aggregation function type

v1AttributeType.description:
Describes AttributeType for a Schema.
Default support for Basic Known DataTypes.

 - ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified AttributeType. This is an Error Scenario
 - ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_STRING: Mentioned for Character Attribute Value field
 - ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_INTEGER: Mentioned for Integer Attribute Value field
 - ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_DOUBLE: Mentioned for Decimal Attribute Value field
 - ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_LONG: Mentioned for Big Integer Attribute Value field
 - ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_BOOLEAN: Mentioned for Boolean Attribute Value field
 - ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_DATETIME: Mentioned for Datetime Attribute Value field
 - ATTRIBUTE_TYPE_ENUM: Mentioned for Enum Attribute Value field

status.description: Overall Status of the request -- SUCCESS/ERROR/PARTIAL.

entities.description: Entities created or failed with status each.

status.description: Overall Status of the request -- SUCCESS/ERROR/PARTIAL.

entities.description: Entities expired or failed with status each.

parent.description: Name of the Dataset for which entities to be updated. This must match with the Dataset Name on each input Entity.

status.description: Overall Status of the request -- SUCCESS/ERROR/PARTIAL.

entities.description: Entities updated or failed with status each.

v1CIDDatasetDefinition.description: Dataset Definition is a metadata of the Dataset.

id.description:
Definition Id as Identifier.
ID is automated from the server and the client does not need to pass value in it.

datasetName.description:
Describes name of the Category, Class, Group or Leaf Level Dataset.
Character Limit: 15.

datasetType.description:
Describes the type of Entities that can be added to a given Dataset. 
This is only applicable for leaf level Datasets and is not applicable for Category, Class nor Group.

author.description:
Login ID of the person or program that created or last modified the Dataset Definition.
Character Limit: 8.

retentionPolicyPeriod.title:
Retention policy period of the dataset is the time after revisionCreateTime that the dataset will be kept as active.
Post the elapsed duration, the dataset will be archived by the system hence cease to be active.
Applies only for leaf level datasets, does not apply to CATEGORY, CLASS and GROUP level datasets
Should be specified in days, Example: 8d (for specifying 8 days)
max value can be "3650d", specifying 10 years
Note: while updating dataset definition, retention policy specified would be ignored

revisionCreateTime.description: Revision create time (in UTC) of the Dataset describes when this version of definition is created.

state.description: Describes the status of the Dataset/Entity and which operations can be performed on it.

description.title:
Describes freeform description of the Category, Class, Group or Leaf Level Dataset.
Character Limit: 255.
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because using existing resource name --)

schemaName.description:
Name of the schema in case of DATASET_TYPE_SCHEMA.
Character Limit: 25.

repoName.description:
Repo name of the Dataset is type of data will be written in this datasets. This should be cde value from CIDS_REPO decode.
This can only be used by ADMIN users while creating Dataset Category and is inherited by other level datasets from its parent category.
Character Limit: 15.

elementPath.description:
Describes Dataset Hierarchy definition. 
Represented through a list of strings separated by a '.' (CATEGORY.CLASS.GROUP.DATASET).

Example: When creating CLASS Dataset TEST_CLASS under TEST_CATEGORY, then elementPath should be 'TEST_CATEGORY.TEST_CLASS'. 
all parents should be active
Character Limit: 64.
(-- api-linter: core::0203::optional=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is required field --)

permGroup.description:
Describes permission group identification for a Category, Class, Group or leaf level Dataset. 
Permissions can be added at Category and Class level only. And is always inherited by Group and Leaf level dataset.

metaInfo.description:
Additional information to assign to the Dataset. 
should be in key=value format
Example: "test=123"
To enable support for adding historical start date entities in dataset -> Key: 'backDatedStartDateSupport' and Value: TRUE/FALSE
Note: you cannot use or update "maxNoOfAttributes" in metaInfo as it is used for internal purpose
Character Limit: 255.

team.description:
Team that owns the Dataset. 
Character Limit: 15.

purpose.description: Purpose is the Dataset Level - Category/Class/Group/Dataset.

datasetFullName.description:
Describes full name of the Category, Class, Group or Leaf Level Dataset.
Character Limit: 75.

attributes.title:
contains List of Schema attribute
max number of attributes is specified in CIDS_CONFIG decode for MAX_ATTRIBUTES decde

schemaAttributeName.description:
Describes name of the attribute.
Character Limit: 15.

indexed.title: Describes whether attribute is indexed(true) or not indexed(false)

metaData.title:
Describes meta data of attribute
Character Limit: 255.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::forbidden-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we're not using data as field name is meta_data --)

description.title:
Describes description of attribute
Character Limit: 255.
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is not of existing resource type --)
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this description field is not of existing resource type --)

attributeDisplayName.description:
Describes display name for attribute
Character Limit: 75.

indexOrder.title:
Describes order of indexed attribute
Should be in numerical order

attributePrecision.title: Describes the precision for an attribute

listMappings.title: Describes mapping for data in Lists that do not exist in CIDS datasets (The key value pairs are actual list names and their display names)

id.description:
Schema Id as Identifier.
Schema name/Id of the Entity Dataset, if Dataset is of SCHEMA type.
Character Limit: 25.

datasetName.description:
Input only field.
Specifies the category or classification dataset in the hierarchy to which this schema can be applied. Any leaf datasets in the specified category / classification can be linked to this schema once created.
Character Limit: 15.

author.description:
Author of the Schema.
Character Limit: 8.

createTime.title: Revision create time (in UTC) of the Schema describes when this version of Schema is created

data.description: Data assigned to the Schema is collection of schema attributes.

id.description:
unique identifier for the entity; of the format : entity_name/{entity_name}/dataset_name/{dataset_name}/start_time/{start_time}/revision_id/{revision_id}
ID is automated from the server and the client does not need to pass value in it.

entityName.description:
Name of the Entity. Entity name should not contain | (pipe character) in it
Character Limit: 32.

datasetName.description:
Dataset name of the Entity. This cannot be Category, Class or Group. Only leaf level Dataset can have Entities.
Character Limit: 15.

entityType.description:
Type of an entity such as isin, cusip, broker etc. Possible values of entity type while creation will eventually be driven from the CIDS_ENT_TYPE decode.
While updating an existing entity, entity type can not be changed and will be defaulted to previous value if no value is provided in current request.
Character Limit: 15.

timeRange.description:
life of the entity (in UTC) - start time and end time
start time and end time - dates shouldn't be in the past
Post the timerange, the entity will be archived by the system hence cease to be active.

revisionCreateTime.description: Revision create time (in UTC) of the Entity describes when this version of Entity is created.

data.title:
Data assigned to the Entity. This can be plain string, JSON, Key-Value pairs or Schema type data.
This is tightly coupled with the type of the Entity Dataset.
Character Limit: 16000.
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is not of existing resource type --)

author.description:
Login ID of the person or program that created or last modified the Entity.
Character Limit: 8.

portfolioName.description:
Portfolio Name - should only be present for Portfolio datasets. Portfolio name should not contain | (pipe character) in it
Character Limit: 10.

v1DatasetType.description:
Describes the type of Entities can be added to this Dataset. 
This is only applicable for leaf level Dataset and not applicable for Category, Class and Group.

 - DATASET_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified TYPE. This type of Dataset can store plain string data in its entities.
 - DATASET_TYPE_KEY_VALUE: KEY_VALUE TYPE. This type of Dataset can store key-value data in its entites.
 - DATASET_TYPE_SCHEMA: SCHEMA TYPE. This type of Dataset can store multi-attributes data.
 - DATASET_TYPE_JSON: JSON TYPE. This type of Dataset can store JSON data in its entities.

v1DateTimeRange.title: This is input parameter for many requests spanning across CIDS

startTime.title:
Start time of the Entity (in UTC). This defaults to current date time when not provided.
While creating/updating Date should not be in the past

expireTime.title:
Expire Time of the Entity (in UTC). This defaults to "12/31/2222" when not provided.
While creating/updating Date should not be in the past
(-- api-linter: core::0214::resource-expiry=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we're not including TTL --)

revisionId.description: Version of the APPROVED Dataset to be expired. User can fetch Version of APPROVED Datset using 'Retrieve all Dataset Definitions' API.

datasetName.description: Dataset Name of the Entity to be expired. This cannot be a Category, Class or group level Dataset.

entityName.description: Name of the Entity to be expired.

startTime.description: Start Time of the APPROVED Entity Version to be expired. User can fetch start time of APPROVED Entity using 'Retrieve Entities' API.

revisionId.description: Version of the APPROVED Entity Version to be expired. User can fetch Version of APPROVED Entity using 'Retrieve Entities' API.

portfolioName.title: Portfolio Name - should only be present for Portfolio datasets

v1PermGroup.description:
Describes permission group identification for a Category, Class, Group or leaf level Dataset.
Permissions can be added at Category and Class level only. And is always inherited by Group and Leaf level Dataset.

 - PERM_GROUP_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified perm group defaults to INDIVIDUAL for Category Dataset and to INHERITED for other level Datasets.
 - PERM_GROUP_INDIVIDUAL: This perm group means the Dataset entry will need to be added to LIST_PERM_GROUP Decodes to add permissions on this Dataset. This value is only permitted for category and class Dataset.
 - PERM_GROUP_INHERITED: This perm group means the permissions will be resolved from parents. This value is only permitted for class, group and leaf Datasets.

v1Purpose.description:
Describes the Dataset level in the Dataset Hierarchy.
Dataset Hierarchy definition is represented through a list of strings separated by a '.' (CATEGORY.CLASS.GROUP.DATASET).

 - PURPOSE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified PURPOSE. When provided API will throw an error.
 - PURPOSE_CATEGORY: Category indicates top level Dataset which contains set of Classes.
 - PURPOSE_CLASS: Class contains set of Groups.
 - PURPOSE_GROUP: Group contains set of leaf level Datasets.
 - PURPOSE_DATASET: Dataset indicates a true leaf level Dataset and is the only purpose that in which Entities can be created.

v1State.description:
- STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified state.
 - STATE_DRAFT: Entity/Dataset in the DRAFT state.
 - STATE_APPROVED: Entity/Dataset in the APPROVED state.
 - STATE_RETIRED: Entity/Dataset in the RETIRED state.
 - STATE_SUSPENDED: Entity/Dataset in the SUSPENDED state.
v1State.title:
Describes the state of the Dataset/Entity describes which operations can be perfromed on it.
Default State for Dataset/Entity is APPROVED.
(-- api-linter: core::0191::file-layout=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because older version is valid --)

v1UpdateCIDEntityRequest.title:
Request for UpdateCIDEntity
(-- api-linter: core::0134::request-mask-required=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because update_mask is not included as we create new version and existing is not updated  --)

filename.title: Name of uploaded file to use for status reponse

dataset.title: Name of the dataset to add entities

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
